snippet: Labor leaders meeting in Los Angeles approved a sharply worded resolution that demanded changes to the federal health care law.
abstract: Labor leaders meeting in Los Angeles criticize Pres Obama and Congress over federal health care law, and approve sharply worded resolution that demands changes to some regulations; leaders praise overall legislation.

byline.original: By STEVEN GREENHOUSE and JONATHAN MARTIN
byline.contributor: Steven Greenhouse reported from Los Angeles, and Jonathan Martin from Washington. Robert Pear contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Labor leaders meeting in Los Angeles approved a sharply worded resolution that demanded changes to the federal health care law.

headline.main: Unions’ Misgivings on Health Law Burst Into View
headline.print_headline: Unions’ Misgivings on Health Law Burst Into View

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: American Federation of Labor-Congress of Industrial Organizations
keywords.name: organizations
